title: Spiced Ravioli, Marches Style
introduction: Discover the culinary delights from the Marches region, where chefs masterfully blend spices to elevate savory dishes. This recipe for Spiced Ravioli, flavored with lemon zest, cinnamon, and nutmeg, brings together a symphony of vegetables and cheese, resulting in a delectable dish. Serve with Marches-Style Ragù or a simple Butter and Sage Sauce for an exquisite meal.
ingredients: 12 ounces assorted greens such as spinach, Swiss chard, chicory, or dandelion
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound Fresh Egg Pasta, rolled out and cut into 4-inch strips
instructions: Put the spinach in a large pot over medium heat with 1/4 cup of water. Cover and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until wilted and tender. Drain and cool. Wrap the spinach in a lint-free cloth and squeeze out as much water as possible. Finely chop the spinach.
In a large bowl, mix together the ricotta, egg, 1/2 cup of the cheese, the lemon zest, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt and pepper to taste.

Prepare the pasta. Make and cook the ravioli as described in the recipe for Cheese Ravioli, steps 2 to 6. Transfer ravioli to a serving bowl. Spoon on the sauce and serve immediately with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
